definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
the breeding season (zool.)/oestrus (period of sexual receptivity of female mammals)

sentences.english: A cow's estrus cycle averages 21 days .
sentences.chinese: 母牛的發情週期平均爲21天。

sentences.english: Significant degranulation in the mast cells was observed mainly during metaestrus.
sentences.chinese: 肥大細胞在發情後期有明顯的脫顆粒現象。

sentences.english: Progesterone is a hormone with different actions dependent on the period in the oestrous cycle.
sentences.chinese: 黃體酮爲孕激素，在動物發情週期中起調控作用。

sentences.english: Chiru, or Tibetan antelope, have arrived for the winter rut.
sentences.chinese: 長角羚或叫藏羚羊已經到了冬季的發情期。

sentences.english: Relationship ruts and boredom are common.
sentences.chinese: 關係的發情和厭倦是很普通的。

sentences.english: Wild boar estrus none seasonally and mate all the year.
sentences.chinese: 公野豬發情無季節性，可以常年配種。

sentences.english: The concentration of LH arrived at the highest value on the day of oestrus and decreased gradually after that day.
sentences.chinese: 促黃體素的含量在發情當日達到最高值以後逐漸下降。

sentences.english: This man seems to have been bitten by a mad dog in 'season'.
sentences.chinese: 這個男人似乎被一條處於發情期的瘋狗給咬了。

sentences.english: The Ovine Oocytes of estrous season was more easier matured in vitro than that of no-estrous season.
sentences.chinese: 發情季節綿羊卵母細胞較乏情季節易成熟。

sentences.english: The grass grows and the horse is ruttish, how reasonable the natural is in turn.
sentences.chinese: 草長馬發情，這種自然界的交替是多麼合乎情理。

sentences.english: I mean, the females can go into heat, or whatever you want to call it, at five weeks old.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，就像人們所說的，母鼠五週大就會發情。
抒發自己的情感就叫發情。

sentences.english: However, in cold areas of estrus sheep still have obvious seasonal.
sentences.chinese: 但是在高寒地區羊的發情仍然有明顯的季節性。

sentences.english: The bitch's cycle is divided into four periods.
sentences.chinese: 母犬的發情週期被分爲一下四個階段。

sentences.english: In cows and many other animals, the female is in estrus just before ovulation .
sentences.chinese: 母牛和許多其他的雌性動物都正好是在排卵前發情。

sentences.english: Donation is like oestrus, they desire it the moment they remember it.
sentences.chinese: 捐款就像發情，想起來了你就想要。

definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
to breed (livestock, fish, crops etc)/to grow/to raise
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
